column4: Description

column1:
Notes: * stands for a number
Standard answer without error for question without ? is always HW part + 0 + 
, e.g. question <F1r
> returns <F10
> (otherwise see column E)
Standard answer without error for question with ? is always HW part + ! + * + 
, e.g. question <F1o?
> may return  <F1!142
> (otherwise see column E)
Standard answer with error is always HW part + error index + 
, e.g. question <F1r
> may return <F11
>; error index can be 1, 2, 3, etc.

column4: Get the software version. EX: V4_C96
Get the sensor head number
Move FW1 to position *=1 to 9
Move FW1 backward by the amount of FWg
Move FW1 backwards for * integer steps
Move FW1 forward by the amount of FWg
Move FW1 forwards for * integer steps
Move FW1 to the mirror
Move FW1 in both directions. Note: used to test the movement of the FW1.
Save current position as the “offset position” for FW1
Read the offset value btw the mirror and the home position for FW1
Change the offset value of the mirror and the home position for FW1 (to reset use F1S0)
Reset FW1 (ends at the OPEN position)
Move FW2 to position *=1 to 9
Move FW2 backward by the amount of FWg
Move FW2 backwards for * integer steps
Move FW2 forward by the amount of FWg
Move FW2 forwards for * integer steps
Move FW2 to the mirror
Move FW2 in both directions. Note: used to test the movement of the FW2.
Save current position as the “offset position” for FW2
Read the offset value btw the mirror and the home position for FW2
Change the offset value of the mirror and the home position for FW2 (to reset use F2S0)
Reset FW2 (ends at the OPEN position)
Get the number of steps between 2 FW positions.
Change number of steps per two adjacent positions for both FWs to *; * is an integer, for 1S it should be *=142, for 2S should be *=150 (WITH THE NEW MOTOR DRIVER THE STEPS=70)
Get the filter wheels speed

Change the speed of the filter wheels to value *. Note: If * is large, the speed is slow and vise versa. The new head sensor board needs slower speed, so we set * = 200. The old head sensor board needs faster speed, so we set * = 100.(WITH THE NEW MOTOR DRIVER THE SPEED=170)
Read Tracker BaudRate (between head sensor and tracker on the tracker side)
column5:
1- <Driver BR is Hardware = Look at the driver BAUD switch , Note: make sure the Switch value is less than 5\n> 
2- <Driver BR is Software = *  Hz\n>
column6:
1- <Driver BR = ERROR: Reg value * is invalid\n> 
2- <HT5\n>

column4: Read Sensor Head BaudRate PORT B (between head sensor and tracker on the head sensor side); note: the return from HTbt? and HTbsB? should match!
column5:
1- <Sensor Head BR (Hardware) = * Hz\n>
2- <Sensor Head BR (Software) =  * Hz\n>
column6:
1- <Sensor Head BR = ERROR: value is invalid  * Hz\n>
2- <HT1\n>

column4: Read Sensor Head BaudRate PORT C (between computer and head sensor); the number in the operation file should match this one
Change the baud rate for the sensor head PORT C; this should be used to change the baud rate between computer and head sensor. Allowed * Values(4800/9600/14400/19200/38400/57600/115200/128000).
Change the Baud Rate to * for the tracker by Hardware. The values for * as follow: (0=9600Hz),(1=19200Hz),(2=38400Hz),(3=57600Hz),(4=115200Hz)
column6:
1- <ERROR: Selected BR is very high for the Sensor Head, So it is set to 4. Note: you need to change the BAUD switch to 4
>
2- <ERROR: Selected BR is very low for the Sensor Head, So it is set to 0. Note: you need to change the BAUD switch to 0
>
3- <HT4
>
4- <HT6
> 
5- <HT1
>
6- <HT5
> 
7- <HT9
>

column4: Find the baud rate of the tracker and sets the sensor head baud rate to match it
column6:
1- <ERROR: Value read from register [0x13 82] is invalid = *
>
2- <HT4
>
3- <HT1
>
4- <HT5
>

column4: Change the Baud Rate to * for the tracker by Software. The values for * as follow: (0=9600Hz),(1=19200Hz),(2=38400Hz),(3=57600Hz),(4=115200Hz); this should be used to change the baud rate between head sensor and tracker
column6:
1- <ERROR: Selected BR is very high for the Sensor Head, So it is set to 4.
>
2- <ERROR: Selected BR is very low for the Sensor Head, So it is set to 0.
>
3- <HT4
>
4- <HT6
>
5- <HT1
>
6- <HT5
>
7- <HT9
>

column4: Read head sensor humidity. Note: need to be divided by 1024. Note: take around 5 sec to receive the reponse.
Read head sensor ID return only the number
Change head sensor ID to “Pan*HST”, *=integer
Read head sensor pressure. Need to be divided by 100. Note: take around 5 sec to receive the reponse.
Reset Head Sensor to restart the program from the beginning(Refreshes Head Sensor Software)
Read head sensor temperature. Need to be divided by 100. Note: take around 5 sec to receive the reponse.
Change direction of Azimuth motor to CCW
Change direction of Azimuth motor to CW
Reset the Alarm for Az, if the LED of the tracker driver lights are flashing. It does not work with all errors.
Read Alarm Code for Az
Change gear A value for Az to * (changes motor resolution)
Change the acceleration of the home position command for Az
Change gear B value for Az to * (changes motor resolution)
Configure Az motor driver after changing any of the driver parameters
Set all the parameters for Az motors such as gear A, gear B, rotation direction, etc ) to the default values.
Read AZ driver temp. need to be divided by 10.
Read Communication Error Code for Az
Check the Azimuth motor parameters
column5:
<AZIMUTH\n\r> AND
<1- Electronic gear A = *\n\r> AND
<2- Electronic gear B = *\n\r> AND
<3- Wrap setting range [rev] = *\n\r> AND
<4- Wrap range offset ratio [%] = *\n\r> AND
<5- Motor rotation direction (Positive side) = * \n\r> (* = CW OR *=CCW) AND
<6- Motor Automatic current cutback function = *\n\r> (*=Disable OR *=Enable) AND
<7- Home operating speed = * Hz\n\r> AND
<8- Home acceleration/deceleration = * Hz/s\n\r> AND 
<9- Home starting speed = * Hz\n\r> AND
<10- Motor operating speed = * Hz\n\r> AND
<11- Motor starting/changing speed rate = * Hz/s\n\r> AND
<12- Motor stopping deceleration = * Hz/s\n\r> AND 
<13- Motor oprating current = *%\n\r> AND
<14- Motor type =  *\n\r> (* = OrientalMotor OR *= old Motor) AND
<EOF>
column6:
<AZIMUTH\n\r> AND
<1- Electronic gear A = ERROR\n\r> AND
<2- Electronic gear B = ERROR\n\r> AND
<3- Wrap setting range [rev] = ERROR\n\r> AND
<4- Wrap range offset ratio [%] = ERROR\n\r> AND
<5- Motor rotation direction (Positive side) = ERROR\n\r> AND
<6- Motor Automatic current cutback function = ERROR\n\r> AND
<7- Home operating speed = ERROR\n\r> AND
<8- Home acceleration/deceleration = ERROR\n\r> AND 
<9- Home starting speed = ERROR\n\r> AND
<10- Motor operating speed = * Hz\n\r> AND
<11- Motor starting/changing speed rate = * Hz/s\n\r> AND
<12- Motor stopping deceleration = * Hz/s\n\r> AND 
<13- Motor oprating current = *%\n\r> AND
<14- Motor type =  *\n\r> (* = OrientalMotor OR *= old Motor) AND
<EOF>

column4: Change the home position of the Az motor to the current position.
Change the starting speed of the home position command
Save changes of the Az driver to the non-volatile memory
Read AZ motor temp. Need to be divided by 10.
Read the tracker current position AZ
Change wrap range offset ration for Az to * (changes motor resolution)
Read the AZ Register
Write the AZ Register
Change the speed of the home position command for Az
Change wrap setting range for Az to * (changes motor resolution)
Read motor current should be (00 3 e8)
Change motor current (only for Oriental)
Change the home position for both Az & Ze motors to the current position.
Read Register number
Change Register number
Read motor speed (should be 0 0 27 10)
Change motor speed (only for Oriental)

Read starting/changing speed rate. (Sets the acceleration/deceleration rate or
acceleration/deceleration time ), 1 to 1,000,000,000 (1=0.001 kHz/s, 1=0.001 s, or
1=0.001 ms/kHz)

Change starting/changing speed rate. (Sets the acceleration/deceleration rate or
acceleration/deceleration time ), 1 to 1,000,000,000 (1=0.001 kHz/s, 1=0.001 s, or
1=0.001 ms/kHz)
Read stopping deceleration (Sets the stopping deceleration or stop time) 1 to 1,000,000,000 (1=0.001 kHz/s, 1=0.001 s, or 1=0.001 ms/kHz)
Change stopping deceleration (Sets the stopping deceleration or stop time) 1 to 1,000,000,000 (1=0.001 kHz/s, 1=0.001 s, or 1=0.001 ms/kHz)
Read motor type (“Oriental Motor”, “FLIR”)

EX(MBt0): Select motor type Directed Perceptions;
EX(MBt1): Select motor type Oriental Motor
Change direction of Zenith motor to CCW
Change direction of Zenith motor to CW
Reset the Alarm for Ze, if the LED lights of the Trcaker Driver are flashing. It does not work with all errors.
Read Alarm Code for Ze
Change gear A value for Ze to * (changes motor resolution)
Change the acceleration of the home position command for Ze
Change gear B value for Ze to * (changes motor resolution)

Configure Ze motor driver after changing any of the driver parameters; Note: after changing any of the motor driver parameters such as home position, gear A/B value, direction of rotation, etc. ones has to send this command to configure the drivers. After that, one needs to send UMa/UMz to save these changes in the non-volatile memory.
Set all the parameters for Ze motors such as gear A, gear B, rotation direction, etc ) to the default values.
Read ZE Driver temp. Need to be divided by 10.
Read Communication Error Code for Ze
Check the zenith parameters
column5:
<ZENITH\n\r> AND
<1- Electronic gear A = *\n\r> AND
<2- Electronic gear B = *\n\r> AND
<3- Wrap setting range [rev] = *\n\r> AND
<4- Wrap range offset ratio [%] = *\n\r> AND
<5- Motor rotation direction (Positive side) = * \n\r> (* = CW OR *=CCW) AND
<6- Motor Automatic current cutback function = *\n\r> (*=Disable OR *=Enable) AND
<7- Home operating speed = * Hz\n\r> AND
<8- Home acceleration/deceleration = * Hz/s\n\r> AND 
<9- Home starting speed = * Hz\n\r> AND
<10- Motor operating speed = * Hz\n\r> AND
<11- Motor starting/changing speed rate = * Hz/s\n\r> AND
<12- Motor stopping deceleration = * Hz/s\n\r> AND 
<13- Motor oprating current = *%\n\r> AND
<14- Motor type =  *\n\r> (* = OrientalMotor OR *= old Motor) AND
<EOF>

<3- Wrap setting range [rev] = ERROR\n\r> AND
<4- Wrap range offset ratio [%] = ERROR\n\r> AND

column4:
Change the home position of the Ze motor to the current position. Note: If you send TRw after the command HRz, you will receive TRh0,0. No Need For UMz/UMa or MCz/MCa. 
Note: Restart the power of the motor drivers. Then, check the position by sending TRw. you should receive TRh0,0
Change the starting speed of the home position command
Save changes of the Ze driver to the non-volatile memory
Read ZE motor temp. Need to be divided by 10.
Read the tracker current position  ZE
Change wrap range offset ratio for Ze to * (changes motor resolution)
Read the ZE Register
Write the ZE Register
Change the speed of the home position command for Ze
Change wrap setting range for Ze to * (changes motor resolution)
Spectrometer 1 power cycle
Get number of relay which is triggered by command “S1s”
Command “S1s” by default triggers relay 3. If you want to assign another relay to this command, for example the relay 4, must be sent S1S4
Spectrometer 2 power cycle
Get number of relay which is triggered by command “S2s”
Command “S4s” by default triggers relay 4. If you want to assign another relay to this command, for example the relay 3, must be sent S1S3
Turn Off the tracker
Turn on the Tracker
Move tracker to position (pan,tilt). For example TRb50000,50000
Read the delay for TRs (Length of time tracker is off in seconds).
Set the delay for TRs (Length of time tracker is off in seconds).
Read the magnetic encoder
Set all tracker parameters for Oriental Motor. Note: <TRo\n> / <TR9\n> takes 3 sec.
Move pan (azimuth) position. For example TRp50000 moves the pan(azimuth) motor to position 50000
Reset Tracker to home position
Tracker power cycle
Get relay triggered by command “TRs”
Command “TRs” by default triggers relay 2. If you want to assign another relay to this command, for example the relay 3, must be sent TRS3
Move tilt (zenith) position. For example TRt50000 moves the tilt(zenith) motor to position 50000
Read the tracker current position AZ, ZE
